original: Ljungfors, Åke Thoriild, fil. lic., Göteborg, f. 29/3/12 i Ängelholm av lä-roviadj. Vilhelm L. o. Ester Thorsson. G. 42 m. Maj Elgstedt. — Stud:-ex. i Malmö 29, fil. kand. i Lund 34, fil. mag. 36, fil. lic. 41, provår v. Hvitfeldtska h. a. 1. i Gbg 42. Res. t. Danm. uppr. ggr, Tyskl. 31, Belgien o. Frankrike 47. Timlärare vid Malmö aftonskola 37-39, vik. assist, vid centralfäng. i Malmö’ 38, tim^lär. vid Malmö realsk. 38-39, kort. vik. på olika platser 39-41, Vasa h. a. 1. i Gbg 43, e. adj. v. Majornas h. a. 1. i Gbg 43-45, v. Vasa h. a. 1. 45-46, sekr. o. reklam-chef v. Gbgs stadsteater sed. 46. På uppdr. av Sv. klassikerförb. utrett klassikernas arb:förhåll. 42, ordf. i Gbgs yngre lärovrlär. fören. 43-46. Skr.: Malmö recess 1524 (41), Biskop Brynoif Algotsson (42) samt ett antal art. o. rec. i pressen. Hobbies: bok-o. frimärkssamlande.
translated: Ljungfors, Åke Thoriild, PhD, Gothenburg, b. 29/3/12 in Ängelholm to district clergyman Vilhelm L. and Ester Thorsson. M. 42 with Maj Elgstedt. - High school degree in Malmö 29, bachelor’s degree in Lund 34, master’s degree in 36, PhD in 41, internship at Hvitfeldtska h. a. 1. in Gothenburg in 42. Traveled to Denmark several times, Germany in 31, Belgium and France in 47. Part-time teacher at Malmö evening school 37-39, temporary assistant at Malmö central prison in 38, hourly teacher at Malmö secondary school 38-39, temporary positions at various places 39-41, Vasa h. a. 1. in Gothenburg in 43, substitute teacher at Majornas h. a. 1. in Gothenburg 43-45, at Vasa h. a. 1. 45-46, secretary and advertising director at Gothenburg city theater since 46. Investigated the working conditions of classics on behalf of the Swedish Classical Association in 42, chairman of Gothenburg's Younger District Teachers' Association 43-46. Writings: Malmö's recess 1524 (41), Bishop Brynoif Algotsson (42), as well as several articles and reviews in the press. Hobbies: collecting books and stamps.

structured.name: Åke Thoriild Ljungfors

workExperience.roleName: Part-time teacher at Malmö evening school
Temporary assistant at Malmö central prison
Hourly teacher at Malmö secondary school

structured.description: Åke Thoriild Ljungfors was a Swedish scholar and educator. He was born on March 29, 1912, in Ängelholm, Sweden, to Vilhelm Ljungfors and Ester Thorsson. He married Maj Elgstedt in 1942. Ljungfors achieved his high school degree in Malmö in 1929, followed by a bachelor's degree from Lund University in 1934. He obtained a master's degree in 1936 and a PhD in 1941. Ljungfors worked as an intern at Hvitfeldtska in Gothenburg from 1942 to 1943 and held various teaching positions in Malmö and Gothenburg. Since 1946, he served as the Secretary and Advertising Director at Gothenburg City Theater. Ljungfors conducted research on the working conditions of classics on behalf of the Swedish Classical Association in 1942 and served as the chairman of Gothenburg's Younger District Teachers' Association from 1943 to 1946. He authored several articles and reviews in the press, including 'Malmö's recess 1524' (1941) and 'Bishop Brynoif Algotsson' (1942). Ljungfors had hobbies of book and stamp collecting.
